    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Slot Machine Simulation using class TripleString. User enters amount to bet with getBet() method which only accepts bets 0 to MAX_BET. A bet of 0 causes simulation to end. Simulator generates random slots and displays result of bet.

        Slot machine has symbols BAR, cherry, (space) and 7 whose text representations are in the strings BAR_STR, CHERRY_STR, SPACE_STR and SEVEN_STR, respectively. The frequency rate for these symbols are defined with BAR_RATE, CHERRY_RATE, SPACE_RATE and SEVENS_RATE respectively (and need to sum to 100%). The pay-out multipliers are set in
        CH_MULT for cherry *** +++
        CH_CH_MULT for cherry cherry ***
        CH_CH_CH_MULT for cherry cherry cherry
        BAR_BAR_BAR_MULT for BAR BAR BAR
        SEV_SEV_SEV_MULT for 7 7 7
        where *** means non-cherry symbol and +++ means any symbol
        Parameters:
        args - not used

      • getBet

        public static int getBet()
        Prompts user for a bet between 0 and MAX_BET. Gives error messages for null and out of range input. Accepts numeric inputs and casts to integer which is returned if in range.
        Returns:
        specified integer

      • pull

        public static TripleString pull()
        Fills the three strings of a TripleString object each with a random string given by randString();
        Returns:
        specified TripleString object

      • display

        public static void display(TripleString thePull,
                           int winnings)
        Displays the results of a slot machine "pull" or gambling try. Results include win or loss and pay-out if a win. The pay-out factor is determined by getPayMultiplier().
        Parameters:
        thePull - result of a slot machine "pull"
        winnings - the amount won with this "pull" (could be 0)
